result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher Darnell Phillips

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Status Report 09-14-2022

Defendant Christopher Darnell Phillips in court.  Attorney Robert J Hampton III in court for Christopher Darnell Phillips.  Prosecuting attorney Patrick O'Keefe in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea/sentencing.  Parties have reached an agreement.  Plea negotiations set forth on the record and agreed upon by the parties.

AS TO COUNT 6:
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on the motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 5 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.  

Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 08-24-2022

Defendant Christopher Darnell Phillips in court.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for plea/sentencing.  Defense counsel is ill and requests an adjournment.  Court rescheduled hearing.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Christopher Darnell Phillips in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: STW  
Case set for scheduling conference. Defense informed the Court that there is a pending case before Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Court authorizes transfer of this case for global resolution. Case adjourned, Branch 38.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Christopher Darnell Phillips in court with Attorney Robert J Hampton; both appear by video.  Defendant Christopher Darnell Phillips in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court took judicial notice of 21CF2446. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer J. Hermann. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  
No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Christopher Darnell Phillips in court with attorney Michael J Cerniglia.  Defendant Christopher Darnell Phillips in custody.  Kelly Hedge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Christopher Darnell Phillips appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 2.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
